column4: i updated today, restarted my system, and it will not boot.  I had the following error: 'Starting Up.... [29.016770]  crc error [29.017559]  Kernel panic- not syncing VFS: Unable to mount root fs on unknown block (0,0)
and sstill having the same error on boot
did I not just say that?
your devices might have changed actually
not sure where your coming from
/dev/hda might become /dev/sda depending on the kerenl what version is the new kernel do you know by chance off the top of your head
is that what you were implying?
the latest update my have moved my devices to different locations?
the newer kernels might be using libata but without me knowing the version of the kernel you installed I can't be sure
are we both talking about the same thing?

I have two machines, this one, and the other in my other office in an entirely different building, as well as one at home.  I updated all three, and its just this one (in my other office) that has crashed from this last update
so I am not sure if you were replying to another question or not
